title: Aia La O Pele
description: A traditional hula honoring Pele, the volcano goddess

hawaiian: Aia la o Pele i Hawai'i
Ke kalali maila i na paia o Kahawali
E ho'i i ke awa la i Puna
I ka papa lau 'awa o Kuki'i
english: The woman who devoured the land at Kahiki
She is raging in the cliffs of Kahawali
Let us return, let us go back
Let us go back to the harbor at Puna
To the 'awa leaf platform of Kuki'i
To the fertile land of Kane
The land of abundant 'awa in Puna

notes: This mele honors Pele, the goddess of fire and volcanoes. The dance movements depict her power and the volcanic landscapes she creates.

title: Kawika
description: A traditional mele honoring King David Kalākaua

hawaiian: Ku'u pua mae 'ole i ka lā
Ua noa, ua noa Hawai'i la
english: My flower that never fades in the sun

notes: This traditional mele honors King David Kalākaua, who was instrumental in reviving hula and other Hawaiian cultural practices during his reign from 1874 to 1891.
